source: have one's work cut out for one
lemma: have one's work cut out for one
definitions: To have a difficult or challenging task to complete.
To have a lot of work to do.
To be faced with a formidable undertaking.
examples: She'll have her work cut out for her to finish by Friday.
They have their work cut out for them to win the championship.
He had his work cut out for him learning a new language.
synonyms: have a lot on one's plate
